item.title: neon.Tap
item.description: I want a picoprobe, because it’s a good all-round debugger. I often need to program I2C and SPI devices. I need JTAG at work. I want them in a single pocketable device. I’ve been playing with a very basic logic analyzer, it just gives you the bitstream it reads - occasionally quite useful. The way I imagine doing this is to just roll the different firmware files into one and save them in flash, then write a custom bootloader that jumps to a specific memory address based on the selected detent on the rotary dial. Electronics wise it’s very simple, we need a dial, an MCU, a flash chip, an LDO or a simple switcher and some output pins.
